intro: Streptanthus insignis, commonly known as the California jewelflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
